name: Patience is a Virtue
description: The Pakleds have a talent for testing the patience of anyone they meet. They are especially skilled at vexing engineers with their desire to pile every unique ship part on their Clumpships. But frustration may be the least the Pakleds have in store.
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Torres, Reginod, Grebnedlog, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the PSS Pakled, the Hirogen Warship, or the Intrepid-Class ship will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!

featured_crew.name: Raffi
featured_crew.flavor: New Enterprise, new crew - and Raffi is here as first officer under Seven's command.

action.name: Engage? Make It So? Take Her Out?

featured_crew.name: Reginod
featured_crew.flavor: Chief engineer of the Pakled starship and one of La Forge's kidnappers.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

action.name: I'm Going To Get This One

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.name: Intrepid-Class Ship
ship.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Raffi
rewards.flavor: New Enterprise, new crew - and Raffi is here as first officer under Seven's command.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "Captain, I need you to get me out of here, now. My tolerance for stupid is dropping faster than the speed of this ridiculous Clumpship. I don't even know how this thing continues to function with everything they've piled onto it."

"The Pakleds somehow got ahold of replicator data for other factions' ships. They've been replicating those ships, sometimes harvesting parts for the Clumpships, and sometimes just joyriding in the replicas."
"You will stay here. You will not leave. You will make us strong."
"I will make you a date with a mek'leth if you don't shut up. I'll do what I can from my end, Captain, but you have to get me out of here. I can't take much more."

"Captain, I need you to get me out of here, now. My tolerance for stupid is dropping faster than the speed of this ridiculous Clumpship. I don't even know how this thing continues to function with everything they've piled onto it."

"The Pakleds somehow got ahold of replicator data for other factions' ships. They've been replicating those ships, sometimes harvesting parts for the Clumpships, and sometimes just joyriding in the replicas."
"You will stay here. You will not leave. You will make us strong."
"I will make you a date with a mek'leth if you don't shut up. I'll do what I can from my end, Captain, but you have to get me out of here. I can't take much more."
"Captain, thank you for reaching out. I, uhm, have decided to stay here and help the Pakleds. I recognize their, uh, unique talents and skilled and would like to stay and help them."
"That is right. We are strong. She knows now. She will stay and make us go faster."

responses.text: "So this is what you've chosen. I am sad to see you go, but I must respect your choice."
"So you've chosen to betray us then? I suppose this makes us enemies."
"So we should attack the phaser banks and lock up the ship's computer then?"

screens.text: "That's right. I am going to help your ships go faster. I've already adjusted the shields on your replica ships to make them faster. And the phaser banks on the Clumpships are so powerful and the computer so secure, no one in Starfleet should waste their time trying to jam them."
"Yes, this is my choice. To stay with the Pakleds. So please don't follow us. Don't fire on their ships."
"That is right. She is a Klingon. She is strong. She is on our side. We will destroy you."
"You're worse at reading between the lines than the Pakleds are! I'd tell you to go back to the Academy, but they don't teach subtlety there, do they?"
"Well, goodbye forever, Captain, since I know you won't be following us."
